intro: Potentilla sibbaldii, commonly known as the sibbald's cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to the Arctic and alpine regions of Europe and Asia. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features small, five-petaled yellow flowers that bloom in early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are palmately lobed and covered in fine hairs, adapted to withstand cold and harsh environmental conditions. Potentilla sibbaldii thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in tundra and alpine meadows.
